claimUnclaimedFund(bytes32,bytes32,bytes.details: Relayer should dry run this call, as they will only get claim fee (gas reimbursement) if this succeeds.

params.emailAddrCommit: The commitment of the recipient's email address to which the unclaimed fund was registered.
params.proof: Proof as required by verifier - prove `pointer` and `commitment` are of the same email address.
params.recipientEmailAddrPointer: The pointer to the recipient's email address.

params.emailAddrCommit: The commitment of the recipient's email address to which the unclaimed fund was registered.
params.proof: Proof as required by verifier - prove `pointer` and `commitment` are of the same email address.
params.recipientEmailAddrPointer: The pointer to the recipient's email address.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

registerUnclaimedFund(bytes32,address,ui.details: `UNCLAIMED_FUNDS_REGISTRATION_FEE` ETH should be supplied to this function.`announceCommitRandomness` and `announceEmailAddr` are optional. They are not validated as well.

params.amount: Amount in WEI of the token.
params.announceCommitRandomness: Randomness used to generate the `emailAddrCommit` - if needs to be public.
params.announceEmailAddr: Email address of the recipient - if needs to be public.
params.emailAddrCommit: Hash of the recipient's email address and a random number.
params.expiryTime: Expiry time to claim the unclaimed fund. Set `0` to use default expiry.

params.amount: Amount in WEI of the token.
params.emailAddrCommit: Hash of the recipient's email address and a random number.

params.announceCommitRandomness: Randomness used to generate the `emailAddrCommit` - if needs to be public.
params.announceEmailAddr: Email address of the recipient - if needs to be public.
params.emailAddrCommit: Email address commitment of the recipient
params.expiryTime: Expiry time to claim the unclaimed state.

params.extensionAddr: Address of the extension contract to which the state is registered
params.recipientEmailAddrCommit: Email address commitment of the recipient
params.sender: Address of the sender of the unclaimed state

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

voidUnclaimedFund(bytes32).details: Callee should dry run this call, as they will only get claim fee (gas reimbursement) if this succeeds.

params.emailAddrCommit: The commitment of the recipient's email address to which the unclaimed fund was registered.
The commitment of the recipient's email address to which the unclaimed state was registered.

claimUnclaimedFund(bytes32,bytes32,bytes.notice: Claim an unclaimed fund to the recipient's (initialized) wallet.

claimUnclaimedState(bytes32,bytes32,byte.notice: Claim unclaimed state to the recipient's (initialized) wallet.

registerUnclaimedFund(bytes32,address,ui.notice: Register unclaimed fund for the recipient - for external users to deposit tokens to an email address.

registerUnclaimedFundInternal(address,by.notice: Register unclaimed fund for the recipient - can be called by Core contract directly

registerUnclaimedState(bytes32,address,b.notice: Register unclaimed state of an extension for the recipient email address commitment

registerUnclaimedStateInternal(address,a.notice: Register unclaimed state from an extension

voidUnclaimedFund(bytes32).notice: Return unclaimed fund after expiry time

voidUnclaimedState(bytes32).notice: Return unclaimed state after expiry time
